1.Pros: Tuition assistance, set weekly schedule, always being trained to move forward

2.Pros: Fun, customers, great multi tasking, learn a lot
2.Cons: low hours, low pay, weird coworkers sometimes

3.Pros: It's an fairly decent summer job.
3.Cons: It's alternating busy and slow times

4.Pros: McDonald's is a very friendly environment and a well established franchise.
4.Cons: The people there get on your nerves sometimes

5.Pros: Excellent place to learn and hone skills, continuous room for improvement. Movement through the employment ranks (Crew, Crew Trainer, Shift manager) is promoted and encouraged
5.Cons: Pay (or lack thereof), work environment can be tedious and aggravating, CUSTOMERS <- if you cannot deal with being cursed at or yelled towards and still manage to respond professionally than food service as a whole isn't a place for you

6.Pros: Flexible hours, Free food, Paid days off
6.Cons: Rude customers, not so helpful management

7.Pros: Great hours and coworkers! I loved my team and the store!

8.Pros: Flexible schedules offered, team Oriented work environment, diverse staff, staff was very professional, active work environment and some career and leadership opportunities.
8.Cons: Pay starting off was minimum wage, would have preferred to be trained by one manager instead of various managers who have different styles of training,no free meals offered.

9.Pros: I love my job I love my crew members
